title: Keerthy Suresh leads Fiona Oil's 'Choose Better' campaign
summary: Bunge India's Fiona Refined Sunflower Oil has launched the 'Choose Better. Eat Better.' campaign, fronted by actress Keerthy Suresh, to encourage healthier cooking oil choices among families. The campaign emphasises the importance of oil-conscious decisions alongside...
fullContent: Bunge India's Fiona Refined Sunflower Oil has launched the 'Choose Better. Eat Better.' campaign, fronted by actress Keerthy Suresh, to encourage healthier cooking oil choices among families. The campaign emphasises the importance of oil-conscious decisions alongside health-conscious food choices. Targeting Kannada and Telugu-speaking audiences, Fiona aims to promote smarter cooking through TV, digital platforms, and in-store visibility.

title: Urban demand, tax cuts to drive India's 6.5 pc growth in FY26

title: Higher US tariffs may trim GDP growth by 30 bps: Barclays
summary: Barclays estimates that the new 25% US tariffs, along with penalties on Russian imports, could reduce India's GDP growth by 30 basis points this fiscal year. Despite the higher duties, India's domestic demand-driven economy is unlikely to be significantly affected.
fullContent: Barclays estimates that the new 25% US tariffs, along with penalties on Russian imports, could reduce India's GDP growth by 30 basis points this fiscal year. Despite the higher duties, India's domestic demand-driven economy is unlikely to be significantly affected.

fullContent: Grok is introducing video generation through its new Imagine feature, powered by Aurora. Users will be able to create videos with sound directly from text prompts. Early access begins in October via the standalone Grok app. A SuperGrok subscription is required to join the waitlist and access the new feature.

fullContent: Saatvik Green Energy has launched a new advertising campaign. Bollywood superstar Kartik Aaryan is the brand ambassador. The campaign aims to boost solar energy use across India. title: Trump crypto group’s report skips strategic bitcoin reserve, but industry remains unfazed
summary: The report released Wednesday by President Donald Trump’s crypto working group offered no new details on the administration’s plans to establish a strategic crypto stockpile, including a bitcoin reserve. Still, industry participants appeared largely unfazed.
fullContent: The report released Wednesday by President Donald Trump’s crypto working group offered no new details on the administration’s plans to establish a strategic crypto stockpile, including a bitcoin reserve. Still, industry participants appeared largely unfazed.

title: Powell Bucks Pressure, Dissents in Showing Resolve on Inflation
summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell shrugged off pressure from the White House and rejected arguments for an interest-rate cut from two dissenting officials, maintaining that the central bank needed to stay on guard against inflation risk.
fullContent: Jerome Powell, chairman of the US Federal Reserve, during a news conference following a Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, July 30, 2025. Federal Reserve officials left interest rates unchanged but downgraded their view of the US economy, a sign policymakers could be edging closer to lowering borrowing costs.

title: ‘Superintelligence’ Will Create a New Era of Empowerment, Mark Zuckerberg Says
summary: Mr. Zuckerberg made his comments about the hypothetical artificial intelligence as Meta posted a 36 percent quarterly increase in profit and a 22 percent jump in revenue.
fullContent: Even as Meta spends big on artificial intelligence, Mark Zuckerberg faces questions about whether the investments will pay off.

title: Treasury Secretary Says Trump Accounts Could Pave Way to Privatizing Social Security
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s comments about the safety net program ventured onto the so-called third rail of American politics.
fullContent: Comments by Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent alluded to a long-held conservative goal: shifting more Americans to rely on financial markets, rather than direct government benefits, to pay for their retirements.

title: Powell Makes Case for Keeping Politics Out of Fed (Full Q&A)
summary: Federal Reserve officials left interest rates unchanged but downgraded their view of the US economy, a sign policymakers could be edging closer to lowering borrowing costs. “Although swings in net exports continue to affect the data, recent indicators suggest that growth of...
fullContent: Federal Reserve officials left interest rates unchanged but downgraded their view of the US economy, a sign policymakers could be edging closer to lowering borrowing costs. “Although swings in net exports continue to affect the data, recent indicators suggest that growth of economic activity moderated in the first half of the year,” officials said in a post-meeting statement. The Fed had previously characterized growth as expanding “at a solid pace.” The Federal Open Market Committee voted 9-2 on Wednesday to hold the benchmark federal funds rate in a range of 4.25%-4.5%, as they have at each of their meetings this year. Governors Christopher Waller and Michelle Bowman voted against the decision in favor of a quarter-point cut. In the q & a, Powell said he thinks it's important for the central bank to maintain its independence -------- Watch Bloomberg Radio LIVE on YouTube Weekdays 7am-6pm ET WATCH HERE: http://bit.ly/3vTiACF Follow us on X: https://twitter.com/BloombergRadio Subscribe
